/tmp/install.sh.content:
#!/bin/bash -ex
export TOKEN=`curl -X PUT "http://169.254.169.254/latest/api/token" -H "X-aws-ec2-metadata-token-ttl-seconds: 21600"`
export EC2_PUBLIC_HOSTNAME=`curl -H "X-aws-ec2-metadata-token: $TOKEN" http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/public-hostname`
/usr/sbin/useradd -mrU git
cd /home/git/
# retrieving installer zip from bucket under the control of curric
wget https://${GIT_AWS_REGION}-${GitRepoName}-tcprod.s3.amazonaws.com/courses/aws-tc-lab-common-resources/lambda-functions/creategitrepocodepipelineintegration/binaries/gogs_0.13.0_linux_amd64.zip
unzip gogs_0.13.0_linux_amd64.zip
mkdir -p gogs/custom/conf
cat /tmp/app.ini  | envsubst > gogs/custom/conf/app.ini
cp /tmp/gogs.service /etc/systemd/system/gogs.service
chown -R git: /home/git/gogs
systemctl start gogs
systemctl enable gogs
/usr/sbin/runuser -u git -- gogs/gogs admin create-user --name $GIT_USERNAME --password $GIT_PASSWORD --email ''

if [ -n "${GIT_REPO_NAME}" ]; then
    # wait for webserver to start
    curl --retry 10 -f --retry-all-errors --retry-delay 2 -s  "http://localhost"

    # get an access token
    ACCESS_TOKEN=$(curl -s -u ${GIT_USERNAME}:${GIT_PASSWORD}  \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --request POST http://localhost/api/v1/users/${GIT_USERNAME}/tokens \
    --data '{"name":"bootstrap"}' | jq -r '.sha1')

    # create the repo
    echo "Creating repo: ${GIT_REPO_NAME}"
    curl -H "Authorization: token ${ACCESS_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --request POST http://localhost/api/v1/user/repos \
    --data "{\"name\": \"${GIT_REPO_NAME}\",\"description\": \"\",\"private\": false}"
    echo

    if [ -n "${GIT_PIPELINE_NAME}" ]; then
        # copy in the post-receive hook
        # need to lowercase the path https://github.com/gogs/gogs/blob/v0.13.0/internal/repoutil/repoutil.go#L61
        echo "Configuring post-receive hook"
        tmpfile=$(mktemp)
        mkdir -p /home/git/gogs-repositories/${GIT_USERNAME,,}/${GIT_REPO_NAME,,}.git/custom_hooks/
        cat /tmp/post-receive |  envsubst '$GIT_PIPELINE_BRANCH,$GIT_PIPELINE_NAME'  > $tmpfile
        chmod +x $tmpfile
        cp $tmpfile /home/git/gogs-repositories/${GIT_USERNAME,,}/${GIT_REPO_NAME,,}.git/custom_hooks/post-receive
        chown -R git: /home/git/gogs-repositories/${GIT_USERNAME,,}/${GIT_REPO_NAME,,}.git/custom_hooks
    fi
    # if a zip is supplied, unzip it and commit
    if [ -n "${GIT_CODE_ZIP}" ]; then
        cd /tmp
        wget ${GIT_CODE_ZIP} -O gitcontents.zip
        mkdir gitcontents ; cd gitcontents
        git init
        git checkout -b ${GIT_CODE_ZIP_BRANCH:-main}
        unzip ../gitcontents.zip
        git add .
        git commit -m "initial commit" --author="Initial commit <no-reply@example.com>"
        git push http://${GIT_USERNAME}:${GIT_PASSWORD}@localhost/${GIT_USERNAME}/${GIT_REPO_NAME}.git ${GIT_CODE_ZIP_BRANCH:-main}
    fi
fi

/tmp/post-receive.content:
#!/bin/sh
while read oldrev newrev refname
do
    branch=$(git rev-parse --symbolic --abbrev-ref $refname)
    if [ "$GIT_PIPELINE_BRANCH" = "$branch" ]; then

        if aws codepipeline start-pipeline-execution --name $GIT_PIPELINE_NAME  &> /dev/null ; then
            echo "Commit received. Initiating $GIT_PIPELINE_NAME pipeline."
        else
            echo "Commit received"
        fi
    fi
done

"Lambda function for CodePipeline integration"
import os
import subprocess
import tempfile
from time import sleep

import boto3

def git_failure(client, job_id, result):
    "Fail the action if there are any git failures"
    print("An error occured in:" + " ".join(result.args))
    print("-" * 80)
    print("stderr: ", result.stderr.decode('utf-8'))
    print("-" * 80)
    print("stdout: ", result.stdout.decode('utf-8'))
    print("-" * 80)

    client.put_job_failure_result(
        jobId=job_id,
        failureDetails={
            'type': 'ConfigurationError',
            'message': 'Possible empty repo or misconfiguration'
        }
    )
    return False

def lambda_handler(event, context):
    "Load any pending source jobs and package source"
    client = boto3.client('codepipeline')

    # eventual consistency problem - we get the event saying the pipeline is executing
    # but sometimes the poll_for_jobs still shows zero jobs
    attempt = 0
    while attempt < 10:
        # provider needs to be a parameter
        jobs = client.poll_for_jobs(actionTypeId={
            'category': 'Source',
            'owner': 'Custom',
            'provider': os.getenv("SOURCE_ACTION_PROVIDER"),
            'version': os.getenv("SOURCE_ACTION_VERSION")})
        sleep(1)
        print(f"Attempt {attempt}: Jobs count {len(jobs['jobs'])}")
        attempt += 1
        if jobs['jobs']:
            break

    for job in jobs["jobs"]:
        job_id = job["id"]
        job_nonce = job["nonce"]
        bucket_name = job["data"]["outputArtifacts"][0]["location"]["s3Location"]["bucketName"]
        object_key = job["data"]["outputArtifacts"][0]["location"]["s3Location"]["objectKey"]
        access_key_id = job["data"]["artifactCredentials"]["accessKeyId"]
        secret_access_key = job["data"]["artifactCredentials"]["secretAccessKey"]
        session_token = job["data"]["artifactCredentials"]["sessionToken"]

        client.acknowledge_job(
            jobId=job_id,
            nonce=job_nonce
        )

        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmpdirname:
            # Define the Git repository URL
            repo_url = os.getenv("GIT_REPO_PATH")
            repo_branch = os.getenv("GIT_PIPELINE_BRANCH")

            # Run the git clone command
            print(f"Cloning from git to: {tmpdirname}")
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git", "clone", "--single-branch", "--branch", repo_branch, repo_url, tmpdirname],
                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                check=False,
                cwd="/tmp"
            )
            if result.returncode != 0:
                return git_failure(client, job_id, result)

            print("Retrieving commit detalis")
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git", "rev-list", "--format=oneline", "--max-count=1", "HEAD"],
                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                check=False,
                cwd=tmpdirname
            )
            if result.returncode != 0:
                return git_failure(client, job_id, result)

            infos = result.stdout.decode('utf-8').split(" ", 1)
            commit, message = infos[0], infos[1].strip()

            print("Building Zip file")
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git", "archive", "-o", "git.zip", "HEAD"],
                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                check=False,
                cwd=tmpdirname
            )
            if result.returncode != 0:
                return git_failure(client, job_id, result)

            # send zip to s3
            zip_file_path = os.path.join(tmpdirname, "git.zip")
            print(f"Sending {zip_file_path} to {bucket_name}/{object_key}")
            s3 = boto3.client('s3',
                            aws_access_key_id=access_key_id,
                            aws_secret_access_key=secret_access_key,
                            aws_session_token=session_token)
            s3.upload_file(zip_file_path,
                        bucket_name,
                        object_key,
                        ExtraArgs={'ServerSideEncryption':'aws:kms'})

        client.put_job_success_result(
            jobId=job_id,
            currentRevision={
                'revision': commit,
                'changeIdentifier': message,  # pipeline doesn't appear to do anything with this?
                'revisionSummary': message
            }
        )
    return True
